event.title: The Viva La Vida Tour
event.description:
PRESS RELEASE
Singapore (February 9, 2009) – Coldplay will be performing in Singapore as part of the Viva La Vida tour on Monday, March 23, 2009. This will be the third time that the multi Grammy Awards band is playing in Singapore, with two sell-out concerts here previously. Tickets will go on sale on 9am, Monday, February 16.

After surfacing in 2000 with the breakthrough single "Yellow", Coldplay quickly became one of the biggest bands of the new millennium. The band’s current album Viva la Vida is the most commercially successful rock album released this decade.

Sweeping up three major awards at the 51st Grammy Awards, Coldplay picked up Best Rock Album, Song of the Year (Viva La Vida), and Best Pop Performance by a Duo or Group With Vocals. The band is also leading at the 2009 BRITS Awards with nominations including British Album, British Group, British Live Act, and British single (Viva La Vida).

Coldplay will be performing a one-night-only show in Singapore with limited tickets available. This is definitely the concert of the year not to be missed!


Tickets: SGD $88 / $158 / $188 / $248
Hotline Booking: (65) 6348 5555
Online Booking: www.sistic.com.sg

http://www.roskilde-festival.dk/
Dyrskuepladsen, Darupvej
4000 Roskilde
Denmark

event.title: Roskilde Festival
event.description:
Warm-up from June 28th

Each year Roskilde Festival attracts a massive audience from all over Europe, and today it is one of the biggest music festivals in Europe. It is a modern, cutting-edge festival which is organised by a non-profit humanitarian organisation on the basis of approximately 25,000 volunteers. All profits from the festival are donated to national and international humanitarian charity and cultural purposes by The Roskilde Festival Charity Society.

Roskilde Festival presents a progressive music programme which offers memorable experiences and lots of surprises. Year after year, the largest international crowd in Europe is drawn to Roskilde because of a combination of this year’s greatest successes, the living legends and the best representatives of the many corners of musical expression.

Each year, about 175 bands play at seven stages during four days from Thursday to Sunday. The camping areas open on the Sunday prior to the festival with music at Pavilion Junior – the stage for upcoming acts – and a wealth of activities during the four days leading up to Thursday. Roskilde Festival is 4 days’ warm-up and 4 days’ music. This is a total of 8 days of partying. Roskilde Festival is a unique and all-encompassing experience where music, events and activities form a unity with the intense sense of community among an emphatic audience.


Roskilde Festival concentrates on quality, innovation, and variation – not on becoming the biggest or the most established festival. Over the years, the festival has gained a solid foundation of experience and routine. However, Roskilde Festival still wants to be cutting edge and innovative.

Roskilde Festival was established in 1971 and have since then presented acts like Arcade Fire, Arctic Monkeys, Beastie Boys, Björk, Black Sabbath, David Bowie, Solomon Burke, The Chemical Brothers, Bob Dylan, Foo Fighters, Gnarls Barkley, Guns N’ Roses, Jay-Z, Judas Priest, The Killers, Kings of Leon, Korn, Kraftwerk, Marilyn Manson, Bob Marley, Metallica, Muse, My Bloody Valentine, New Order, Nirvana, Queens Of The Stone Age, Radiohead, Rage Against The Machine, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Scissor Sisters, Slayer, Slipknot, The Streets, The Strokes, Talking Heads, Tiësto, Tool, U2, Underworld, Robbie Williams, Roger Waters, Kanye West, The White Stripes, The Who, Brian Wilson, Wu-Tang Clan, Neil Young and many many others.

Access to camping and parking is included in the ticket. Camping facilities include hot and cold showers, communal grills, food and drink stalls, shopping areas, cinema, street sports, skate ramp, free luggage storages and lots of activities and events.

Rumors:
Placebo
Marujah
Natten
Phatbeatzz
Lily Allen

event.title: Coldplay: The Viva La Vida Tour
Coldplay
event.description: Die herausragende britische Band dieses Jahrzehnts präsentiert ihre Viva La Vida Tour Ende August in drei deutschen Städten: Hannover, Düsseldorf und München. Coldplay, die mit weit über 30 Millionen Alben, vier Grammies, sechs Brit Awards und zahlreichen Multiplatinauszeichnungen zu den überragenden Protagonisten der internationalen Musikszene zählen, haben sich nach eigenen Worten musikalisch der extrem harten Sanftheit der Rockmusik verschrieben. Das Quartett zeigte sich mit seiner jüngsten Nr. 1-CD „Viva La Vida“ experimentierfreudig, ohne den typischen Sound und die lyrischen Wortspiele aufzugeben. Neue Ideen und Einflüsse gehören ebenso zum Programm der umjubelten Coldplay-Tournee wie Songs der gefeierten Album-Trilogie „Parachutes“, „A Rush Of Blood To The Head“ sowie „X & Y“.

event.title: Coldplay
event.description:
from www.coldplay.com

Italian and Spanish shows announced - 12.12.08

We have another two big outdoor shows to announce for next summer. On Monday 31st August 2009, Coldplay will be playing at the Stadio Friuli in Udine, Italy. A few days later, on Friday 4th September, they'll roll into Barcelona, Spain to play at the Estadi Olimpic. Tickets for the Udine show will be available on Tuesday (Dec 16th) from ticketone.it, while the Barcelona show will be onsale from Wednesday (Dec 17th) from livenation.es.

event.title: Coldplay
event.description: We can announce that a second show at Goffertpark in Nijmegen, Holland has been confirmed, after the first one sold out. The second gig will take place on Wed 9th Sept 2009. Tickets go on sale this morning from www.livenation.nl.

event.title: Coldplay
event.description:
MOJO Concerts, Delft, 1 december 2008

coldplay KOMT TERUG NAAR NEDERLAND

Vandaag is bekend gemaakt dat Coldplay volgend najaar terugkomt naar Nederland voor een concert in het Goffertpark in Nijmegen. Het concert vindt plaats op donderdag 10 september 2009. De kaartverkoop begint aanstaande vrijdag om 10.00 uur via livenation.nl en 0900 10102020 (45 ct.p.m).

Na de twee uitverkochte en zeer goed ontvangen concerten in Ahoy afgelopen oktober gaat Coldplay met het komende concert de openlucht in. Het Britse viertal staat op 10 september in het Goffertpark in Nijmegen in het kader van hun Viva La Vida Tour.

Het album Viva La Vida lijkt weer alle records te gaan breken. De eerste single ‘Violet Hill’, werd door de band via internet gratis aangeboden aan alle fans en werd binnen één week door 2 miljoen mensen gedownload. Na een aantal maanden staat het nummer nog steeds hoog in de hitlijsten, en ook de nieuwe single Lost met Jay-Z belooft een enorm succes te gaan worden. Vorige week bracht Coldplay daarnaast een speciale dubbeleditie van het album uit, met daarop maar liefst 8 nieuwe tracks.

‘Viva La Vida’, dat werd geproduceerd door grootheden Brian Eno en Markus Dravs is het vervolg op het album ‘X&Y’ uit 2005 dat in 32 landen op nr. 1 binnen kwam en waarvan 10 miljoen exemplaren werden verkocht.

Woensdag 3 december aanstaande om 17.00 uur start de presale van Live Nation. Leden van de Live Nation krijgen dan tot donderdag 4 december 17.00 uur, dus vóór de reguliere kaartverkoop, de gelegenheid om kaarten voor Coldplay te bestellen via www.livenation.nl. Maximaal 8 kaarten per persoon.

3FM presents
COLDPLAY

& support act
Donderdag 10 september 2009
Goffertpark - Nijmegen
Entree: € 59 (excl. servicekosten)
Aanvang: 18.00 uur
Let op: maximaal 8 kaarten per persoon

Kaartverkoop begint aanstaande vrijdag om 10.00 uur via www.livenation.nl en 0900-10102020 (45 ct.p.m).
